definitions: To happen as planned or expected; to succeed.
To become detached or separated from something.
To appear or seem in a particular way; to be perceived.
To stop taking a drug or medication.
To perform in a particular way in a competition or test.
examples: The party really came off well.
The button came off my shirt.
He came off as very arrogant.
She came off the medication after a month.
How did you come off in the exam?
